alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:25PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN PINE, SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS, NORTHWESTERN WASHBURN AND NORTHERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM CDT... At 424 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Duxbury, to near Mille Lacs Band Lena Lake Area, to 9 miles north of Grantsburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Duxbury and Mille Lacs Band Lena Lake Area around 430 PM CDT. Danbury and Cloverton around 440 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Webster, Dairyland and Webb Lake Wisconsin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.
